etymologies: late 19th century. From absinth + -ol. Compare German Absinthol, French absinthol

definitions: An oily liquid that is a constituent of several essential oils, notably oil of wormwood; = "thujone".

notes.text: Absinthol is a bicyclic monoterpenoid ketone. Systematic name: 4-methyl-1-(1-methylethyl)bicyclo[3.1.0]-hexan-3-one; C₁₀H₁₆O.
